Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the severity of the coronavirus outbreak by stating that it is "very very serious & fatal" and that there is no cure once infected.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any credible sources or evidence to support its statements about the severity of the outbreak or the prevention methods mentioned.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the emergency warning mentioned in the text is legitimate and issued by the Indian government, without providing any proof or verification.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider the possibility that the emergency warning is a hoax or misinformation, as confirmed by the Indian government's Press Information Bureau.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Indian government has explicitly stated that no such emergency warning was issued, as stated by the Press Information Bureau.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in this claim.
